Service Details: - Encourages Canadians to be prepared to cope on their own for at least the first 72 hours of an emergency by knowing the risks in their community, making an emergency plan, and getting an emergency kit, enabling first responders to focus on those in urgent need- Works closely with the provinces and territories, non-government organizations (NGOs), and other key partners- Offers a mapped database of Canadian Disasters, Safety Tips, a range of publications, research, a list of emergency management organizations and videos
